author: Sara Mellas
title: Easy White Cheese & Garlic Pizzas
ingredients: 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese (or shredded pizza blend cheese, 1 cup is 4 oz.)
4 ounces ricotta cheese (4 oz. is 1 scant cup)
instructions_list: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Arrange the naan on the baking sheet. Drizzle an equal amount of olive oil over the surface of each piece.
description: Extra cheese and extra garlic? Yes, please! No red sauce is needed for these mouthwatering naan pizzas. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

reviews.author: OlympiaProdafikas
reviews.reviewBody: Great recipe! Substituted garlic with garlic powder and turned out just fine!

reviews.author: BooSchara
reviews.reviewBody: easy recipe. came out jist as planned. could use something else to boost flavor. maybe some goat cheese

reviews.author: Hi95468
reviews.reviewBody: The only part of the recipe I really follwed was the instructions to cook, I made my pizza with ranch and buffalo sauce as a base and mozzarella cheese on top. Came out really well!

reviews.author: RachaelHookano
reviews.reviewBody: Super easy and delicious! I took it out at 8 minutes because it was already very toasty (which I loved), any longer and it would have burnt. I didn’t have the basil but everything else complimented each other. The gooey cheese, the freshness of the herbs, and the slight saltiness of the Parmesan brought this dish together. It took me less than 20 minutes to prepare and cook this meal, which is always a plus.

reviews.author: SuzanneCarella
reviews.reviewBody: Easy and delicious! I left at 15 min without checking beforehand so turned out a bit over cooked but otherwise it was great.

reviews.author: OhGoshDanger.
reviews.reviewBody: really good. it tasted like it needed a sauce.

reviews.author: EmilyHall14
reviews.reviewBody: Super easy and filling!

reviews.author: EvanWahl
reviews.reviewBody: Great blend of flavors, and very quick and easy to make

reviews.author: AnnaSnider5
reviews.reviewBody: Yummy- kids loved it

reviews.author: CandaceMadry
reviews.reviewBody: great with red pepper flakes!

reviews.author: RyleyPayne
reviews.reviewBody: I modified it a bit I probably wouldn't make it again

reviews.author: BrilliantCook379
reviews.reviewBody: I added some lettuce and tomato to the side to make dinner, but it smelled delicious and cheesey the whole time i made it. I also improvised on the herbs a bit and it tasted as good as it looked

reviews.author: AgileSousChef1693
reviews.reviewBody:
It was excellent! Hubby loved it too. 
Made a few additions like a thinly sliced tomato, mushrooms, yellow & orange peppers, & smoked mozzarella. 
YYYYYummmm...

reviews.author: Shawn3188
reviews.reviewBody: it was delicious I cooked the garlic cloves in olive oil for about 10 mins on low and then chopped and added to pizza. i also added italian sausage fresh mushrooms and white onions it was amazing.

reviews.author: Jb211
reviews.reviewBody: Added garlic salt and sautéed baby Bella mushrooms. Very tasty.

reviews.author: StaceyCroley
reviews.reviewBody: It was really good. The downsides of it were the garlic tasted raw so I might sauté in a skillet beforehand next time & 14 minutes was too long in our oven so I will probably turn down the heat a little and cook it for a shorter time frame

reviews.author: FantasticSousChef9841
reviews.reviewBody: I did it on the grill instead very tasty

reviews.author: NoobChef
reviews.reviewBody: Very tasty- great way to use up leftover ricotta

reviews.author: CunningSousChef7594
reviews.reviewBody: My family loved this!

reviews.author: KeenHomeChef833
reviews.reviewBody: Really simple, fast and tasty recipe.
